{{AfC submission|t||ts=20220625122552|u=Asdfjrjjj|ns=118|demo=}} {{short description|xxx}} {{use dmy dates|date=June 2022}} {{use British English|date=June 2022}} {{Infobox organization | name = National Institute of Culture and History | full_name = | native_name = | native_name_lang = | logo = NICH logo 2022.svg | logo_size = | logo_alt = | logo_caption = | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | map = | map_size = | map_alt = | map_caption = | map2 = | map2_size = | map2_alt = | map2_caption = | abbreviation = NICH | nickname = | pronounce = | pronounce ref = | pronounce comment = | pronounce 2 = | named_after = | predecessor = Office of the Governor | merged = | successor = | formation = {{start date and age|1952|7|1|df=y}} {{small|/ as Department of Archaeology}} | founder = Alexander Hamilton Anderson | founding_location = | dissolved = | merger = | type = | tax_id = | registration_id = | status = | purpose = regulation and preservation | professional_title = | headquarters = 3401 Mtn View Blvd
Belmopan
Belize | location_city = | location_country = | location_city2 = | location_country2 = | addnl_location_city = | addnl_location_country = | addnl_location_city2 = | addnl_location_country2 = | coordinates = {{coord|17.246433422048653|-88.77213542698502|region:BZ_type:landmark|display=inline,title}} | origins = | region_served = | products = | services = | methods = | fields = | membership = | membership_year = | language = | owner = | sec_gen = | leader_title = | leader_name = | leader_title2 = | leader_name2 = | leader_title3 = | leader_name3 = | leader_title4 = | leader_name4 = | board_of_directors = | key_people = | main_organ = | parent_organization = | subsidiaries = {{unbulleted list|Institute of Archaeology|Institute of Creative Arts|Institute for Social & Cultural Research|Museum of Belize & Houses of Culture}} | secessions = | affiliations = Ministry of Education, Culture, Science and Technology | budget = | budget_year = | revenue = | revenue_year = | disbursements = | expenses = | expenses_year = | endowment = | endowment_year = | funding = | staff = | staff_year = | volunteers = | volunteers_year = | students = | students_year = | awards = | website = {{URL|nichbelize.org}} | remarks = | formerly = | footnotes = | bodystyle = }} The '''National Institute of Culture and History''' is an executive non-departmental public body of the [[Government of Belize|Belizean Government]], sponsored by the Ministry of Education, Culture, Science and Technology. It is tasked with xxx. == History == The superintendent-organised and tax-funded 1839{{en dash}}1840 expedition to [[Palenque]] by Patrick Walker and John Herbert Caddy is often regarded as the Belizean Government's earliest investment in archaeological, cultural, or artistic research.{{sfn|Saler|1968|p=273}}{{notetag|Prior to the expedition, Walker worked as secretary to the superintendent, while Caddy served as lieutenant in the [[Royal Artillery]] {{harv|Saler|1968|p=273}}. Expeditionary records and lithographs were belatedly published in {{harvnb|Pendergast|1967}} {{harv|Saler|1968|p=273}}. Collected artefacts were donated by [[William Stevenson (colonial administrator)|William Stevenson]] to the [[British Museum]] in 1856{{en dash}}1857 ({{harvnb|Mongey|2021|p=85}}, {{harvnb|BM|2022|loc=secs. 'Biography' and 'Related Objects'}}).}} Similar projects, however, were sporadic until the 1952 appointment of Alexander Hamilton Anderson as First Assistant Secretary to the Governor ''with'' responsibility for archaeological activities in the country, and the subsequent 1954 establishment of the Department of Archaeology, with Anderson as its inaugural ''commissioner'' or permanent secretary.{{sfn|Nichols|Pool|2012|p=71}}{{sfn|Pendergast|1993|p=7}}{{sfn|Beardall|2021|p=28}}{{notetag|Though [[Thomas Gann]], a civil servant, conducted some of the earliest excavations in Belize in 1894{{en dash}}1936, and may have prompted the country's earliest legislative protections for archaeological sites and artefacts in 1894, and their subsequent strengthening in 1897, 1924, 1927, and 1928 ({{harvnb|Nichols|Pool|2012|pp=69-71}}, {{harvnb|Wallace|2011|p=25}}, {{harvnb|Pendergast|1993|p=4}}, {{harvnb|Hammond|1983|p=22}}).}}{{notetag|Establishment of the Department of Archaeology dated 1953 by {{harvnb|Vitelli|1983|p=218}}, 1957 by {{harvnb|Nichols|Pool|2012|p=71}}.}} In 2003, the Department of Archaeology was merged with three other governmental departments, by act of Parliament, to form the National Institute of Culture and History, this latter body being modelled after its [[INAH|Mexican counterpart]].{{sfn|Nichols|Pool|2012|pp=72, 75}} == Remit == == Leadership == {{Static row numbers}} {| class="sortable static-row-numbers" style="text-align:left;" |+ Past leadership of NICH and predecessor bodies.{{sfn|Nichols|Pool|2012|pp=71-72}} |- ! class=unsortable| Name ! Start ! End ! class=unsortable| Title ! class=unsortable| Body |- | Alexander Anderson | 1952 | 1954 | First Assistant Secretary with responsibility for archaeology | Office of the Governor |- | Alexander Anderson | 1954 | 1967 | Commissioner | Department of Archaeology |- | David Pendergast | 1967 | 1968 | Commissioner ''ad interim'' | Department of Archaeology |- | Peter Schmidt | 1968 | 1971 | Commissioner | Department of Archaeology |- | Joseph Palacio | 1971 | 1977 | Commissioner | Department of Archaeology |- | Jaime Awe | 1977 | 1978 | Commissioner ''ad interim'' | Department of Archaeology |- | Elizabeth Graham | 1978 | 1980 | Commissioner | Department of Archaeology |- | Harriot Topsey | 1980 | ? | Commissioner | Department of Archaeology |- | Winnel Branche | ? | ? | Commissioner | Department of Archaeology |- | Allan Moore | ? | ? | Commissioner | Department of Archaeology |- | John Morris | ? | ? | Commissioner | Department of Archaeology |- | Brian Woodye | ? | ? | Commissioner | Department of Archaeology |- | George Thompson | ? | ? | Commissioner | Department of Archaeology |} == Notes == {{reflist}} {{notefoot}} == References == {{refbegin}} #
